text: Is it at all possible to make POST requests that use Basic Auth as a custom workflow?
I have a customer who wants to use our SMS API (<http://46elks.com|46elks.com>) as part of their workflows.

Hi Ben, you could make an app like Sakari SMS did: <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/live-chat/sakari-sms>  They also have a Workflow API: "Custom Workflow API: Use Sakari as an action OR a trigger within HubSpot workflows."
I’d ideally not like to create an entire app at this stage, that seems like a considerable task,
Yes you can use the webhook action
Not with Basic Auth as I understand
I am probably wrong though so please enlighten me
Yep, I'm am incorrect you can't change the headers of the request
So you could use a custom coded action to do it

When configuring a Workflow Action `inputFieldDependencies` is an option. I have discovered two different dependency types: `SINGLE_FIELD` (in the docs) and `CONDITIONAL_SINGLE_FIELD` (not in the docs. I found in this Slack). Is there a place that `inputFieldDependencies`  is more fully documented with all the options available?

Besides other peoples brains/messages in the different communities really the best docs are the example tab in the workflow custom action documentation. Like you said that conditional actions aren't in the docs but they really are:

Hi All, is there a way to set the Task type to “call” if in another state? For context, our sales team have been using sequences and the task is always set to To do, is this possible to do this via a workflow?

Hmm I'm going to flag this with the team, there used to be more content about this.

Here's a sample from an old version of the doc
> *Example 3*
> A custom action with field dependencies and options that are fetched from an API. Because the widget size depends on the widget color, the Workflows user won't be able to input a value for the widget size until a widget color is chosen. The widget cost is also dependent on the widget color, but it is conditional on the value that the user selects for the widget color; the Workflows user won't be able to input a value for the widget cost unless "Red" is selected as the widget color.
Oh thanks <@U0157R7AQ84> that would be awesome
That section is still in the docs, but I think it would be value to have a section on it in the overview section

Hey folks. We’ve started to dip our toes into custom-coded workflow actions and have run into a particular need for customers in the non-profit space.

I’m curious if the following *Contact* workflow is possible:

• Workflow triggers based on ‘Recent deal close date’ being updated (Is known)
• Custom action - Get all related deals with a 100% probability, then find the one with the biggest amount
• Write this deal’s amount and close date to custom fields on the contact
Heck yeah that's super possible and pretty simple
